pullRequest.body:
Together with #9017 and #8965 we can convert group theory problems to linear algebra problems as in the
[homomorphism form of PFR](https://teorth.github.io/pfr/blueprint/sect0008.html).


---

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7227338554/job/19694777749)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7227338554/job/19694778110)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7227338554/job/19694777613)

We usually use `M` for modules, even if they're additive groups. Can you change this back to the old names?

(That also has the advantage of making the diff much smaller)
Thanks, nice catch, fixed! (I'd accidentally thought "M" stood for "Monoid" - in my own code 😅)
I had the idea to copy these simp lemmas from `toIntSubmodule`, but is there a way to automate these off of `≃o`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: subgroups of Z/nZ-modules are submodules
